heading: HR00576
0: A RESOLUTION URGING THE COMMITTEE ON HEALTH TO CONDUCT AN INQUIRY INTO THE LATEST FINDINGS OF THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION THAT THERE ARE 1.1 BILLION PEOPLE WORLDWIDE THAT SUFFER FROM HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE WITH THE BURDEN OF THE CONDITION SHIFTING FROM THE RICH TO THE POOR COUNTRIES AND PUTTING TOGETHER A NATIONAL COUNTERMEASURE
status: Pending with the Committee on HEALTH since 2016-12-07
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HR00576
FULL TITLE : A RESOLUTION URGING THE COMMITTEE ON HEALTH TO CONDUCT AN INQUIRY INTO THE LATEST FINDINGS OF THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION THAT THERE ARE 1.1 BILLION PEOPLE WORLDWIDE THAT SUFFER FROM HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE WITH THE BURDEN OF THE CONDITION SHIFTING FROM THE RICH TO THE POOR COUNTRIES AND PUTTING TOGETHER A NATIONAL COUNTERMEASURE
